summary.long: Jeremiah is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The words of Jeremiah son of Hilkiah, who was one of the priests from Anathoth in the land of Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to him in the thirteenth year of the reign of Josiah son of Amon, king of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and continued through the reign of Jehoiakim son of Josiah, king of Judah, until the eleventh year of Zedekiah son of Josiah, king of Judah, up to the time of the exile of Jerusalem in the fifth month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before I formed you in the womb, I knew you,
and before you were born, I set you apart.
I appointed you to be a prophet to the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I said, “Ah, Lord God! I really do not know how to speak! I am only a child!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to me, “Do not say, ‘I am only a child.’ You must go to everyone to whom I send you and say whatever I command you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not be afraid of them, because I am with you, and I will rescue you, declares the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord stretched out his hand and touched my mouth. The Lord said to me:
There! I have now placed my words in your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, today I appoint you over nations and kingdoms
to uproot and to tear down,
to destroy and to overthrow,
to build and to plant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Again the word of the Lord came to me: “What do you see, Jeremiah?”
I answered, “I see a branch of an almond tree.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to me, “That is correct. You have observed accurately. And this vision means that I am watching over my word to fulfill it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The word of the Lord came to me a second time: “What do you see?”
I answered, “I see a boiling pot tipped away from the north.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord said to me:
Disaster will boil over from the north on everyone who lives in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen, I am summoning all the clans from the northern kingdoms, declares the Lord. They will come, and each one will set up his throne at the entrance of the gates of Jerusalem. They will come against all the surrounding walls and against all the cities of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will pronounce my judgments against Judah because of their wickedness. They have abandoned me. They have made burnt offerings to other gods, and they have bowed down to the work of their own hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now you, get ready. Rise up and tell them everything I am commanding you. Do not be frightened by them, or I will frighten you in their presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look, today I have made you like a fortified city, like an iron pillar, and like bronze walls, to take a stand against the whole land. Stand against the kings of Judah, its officials, its priests, and the people of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will fight against you, but they will not overcome you, because I am with you to rescue you, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Go and proclaim this in the hearing of Jerusalem.
This is what the Lord says.
This is what I remember concerning you:
    your faithfulness when you were young,
    and your love when you were pledged in marriage.
I remember how you followed me in the wilderness,
in a land that has never been planted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Israel was set apart as holy to the Lord,
    the firstfruits of his harvest.
All those who devoured Israel became guilty,
and disaster came upon them, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear the word of the Lord, you house of Jacob.
All you families of the house of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
this is what the Lord says.
What fault did your fathers find in me,
that they departed so far from me?
They followed worthless idols,
and so they became worthless themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They did not say,
“Where is the Lord, who brought us up from the land of Egypt?
Where is the one who led us through the wilderness,
    through a desert wasteland filled with ravines,
    through a land of drought and the shadow of death,
    a land which no one passes through,
    a land where no human being lives?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I brought you into a fertile land,
to eat its fruit and its good things.
But you defiled my land
and made my inheritance repulsive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The priests did not ask, “Where is the Lord?”
The experts in the law did not acknowledge me.
Their shepherds rebelled against me.
The prophets prophesied by Baal
and went after useless idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I am bringing charges against you again, declares the Lord,
and I am bringing charges against your children’s children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cross over to the coasts of Cyprus and look.
Send someone to Kedar and observe carefully.
See if there has ever been anything like this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Has a nation ever exchanged its gods
(even though they are not gods at all)?
Yet my people have exchanged their Glory
    for useless idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be appalled at this, you heavens.
Be horrified and wither away completely, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For my people have committed two evils:
They have abandoned me, the spring of living water,
and they have dug their own cisterns,
broken cisterns that hold no water!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is Israel a servant, born into slavery?
Why then has Israel been plundered?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Young lions have roared at him.
They have growled loudly.
They have made his land desolate.
His towns are burned and deserted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The men of Memphis and Tahpanhes
    have shaved the top of your head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have you not brought this on yourself
    by deserting the Lord your God
    while he led you on the way?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So why are you on the road to Egypt
    to drink the water of the Shihor?
And why are you on the road to Assyria
    to drink the water of the River?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is your own evil that will bring discipline on you.
Your backsliding will judge you.
Know and see how evil and bitter it is for you
    to forsake the Lord your God,
    to have no fear of me,
declares the Lord God of Armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Long ago I broke your yoke.
I tore off your chains,
but you said, “I will not serve you!”
Instead, on every high hill
and under every green tree
you sprawl out like a prostitute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I planted you as a very good vine,
healthy and from reliable stock.
How then did you turn against me?
How then did you turn into a wild vine?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even if you scrub yourself with cleanser
and use a lot of strong soap,
the stain of your guilt is before me, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How can you say, “I have not defiled myself.
I have not gone after the Baals”?
Look what you did in the valley!
Think about what you did!
You were a fast female camel
    running wildly all over the place,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
or a wild donkey accustomed to the wilderness,
    sniffing the wind in her passion.
Who can control her when she is in heat?
None of the males who pursue her will become tired.
They will find her in her mating time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Stop before your shoes wear out
and your throat becomes dry!
But you say, “It’s hopeless!
I love strange gods, and I must pursue them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a thief is shamed when he is caught,
so the house of Israel will be shamed—
the people, their kings, their officials,
their priests, and their prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They say to wood, “You are my father.”
They say to stone, “You gave birth to me.”
They have turned their backs to me
and not their faces.
But when a time of trouble comes, they say,
“Get up and save us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where are the gods you made for yourselves?
Let them rise up,
if they are able to save you in a time of trouble.
After all, Judah, you have as many gods as you have towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you bring charges against me?
You have all rebelled against me, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I punished your people in vain.
They did not respond to correction.
Your own sword has devoured your prophets,
    like a raging lion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You people of this generation,
consider the word of the Lord.
Have I been a wilderness to Israel,
or a land of deep darkness?
Why do my people say, “We are free to wander.
We will not come to you anymore”?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Does a virgin about to be married forget her jewelry?
Does a bride forget her veil?
But my people have forgotten me for countless days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How practiced you are in the ways that you pursue love!
Even the most evil women could learn from your ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lifeblood of poor, innocent people is found on your skirt,
even though you did not catch them breaking in.
In spite of all this,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
you say, “I am innocent.
He will not be angry with me.”
But I have indeed judged you
because you say, “I have not sinned.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How fickle you are in changing your direction!
You will be disappointed by Egypt,
just as you were by Assyria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So you will leave there with your hands on your head,
because the Lord has rejected the ones you trust.
You will receive no help from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If a man divorces his wife
and she leaves him and marries another man,
can he return to her again?
Wouldn’t acting like that completely defile the land?
But you have lived like a prostitute with many lovers.
And now you want to return to me?
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look up to the bare hills and see.
Is there any place where you have not engaged in sex?
You sat by the roadsides waiting for lovers,
    like a nomad in the desert.
You have defiled the land with your prostitution and wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That is why the showers have been withheld,
and the spring rains have not come.
Yet you have the shameless look of a prostitute.
You refuse to be ashamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Did you not just call to me, “My father!
You are my close friend from my youth!”?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You say, “Will he be angry for so long?
Will he keep up his wrath forever?”
Yes, that is what you say,
but you do whatever evil you can.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the days of King Josiah, the Lord asked me:
Have you seen what unfaithful Israel did? She has gone up onto every high hill and under every green tree and acted like a prostitute there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I told myself that after she did all this, she would return to me, but she did not return, and her treacherous sister Judah saw it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Unfaithful Israel committed adultery, so I sent her away. I gave her a certificate of divorce, yet I saw that in spite of this, her treacherous sister Judah had no fear. She also went and acted like a prostitute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since Israel regarded her sexual sins so lightly, she defiled the land by committing adultery with stones and trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In spite of all this, her treacherous sister Judah did not turn back to me with all her heart, but only pretended, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord said to me:
Unfaithful Israel is more righteous than treacherous Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Go, proclaim these words to the north.
Return, unfaithful Israel, declares the Lord.
I will no longer frown on you,
because I am merciful, declares the Lord.
I will not be angry forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At least acknowledge your guilt.
Admit that you rebelled against the Lord your God.
You have distributed your favors to strangers under every green tree,
and you have not listened to me, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Return, unfaithful people, declares the Lord, because I am your husband. I will take you—one from a city, two from a family—and bring you to Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I will give you shepherds after my own heart, who will feed you with knowledge and understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days, when you have been fruitful and increased in number in the land, declares the Lord, men will no longer say, “The Ark of the Covenant of the Lord.” It will not enter their minds. It will not be remembered. It will not be missed, nor will another one be made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they will call Jerusalem “The Throne of the Lord.” All nations will gather there in Jerusalem for the sake of the name of the Lord. No longer will they stubbornly follow their own evil hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days the house of Judah will join with the house of Israel, and together they will come from a land in the north to the land I gave your fathers as an inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I myself said that I would like to treat you like sons
and give you a desirable land,
the most splendid inheritance among the entire army of nations.
I thought you would call me Father
and would no longer turn away from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you, O house of Israel, have been unfaithful to me,
like a wife who is unfaithful to her husband, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A cry is heard on the bare hills,
the weeping and pleading of the people of Israel,
because they have perverted their way.
They have forgotten the Lord their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Return, unfaithful people.
I will cure you of your unfaithfulness.
Yes, we will come to you,
for you are the Lord our God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, there has been deception from the hills,
and commotion in the mountains,
but there is salvation for Israel in the Lord our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Since our younger days,
    shameful gods have consumed the results of our fathers’ hard work,
    their sheep and cattle,
    and their sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We will lie down in that shame.
Our disgrace covers us.
We have sinned against the Lord our God,
both we and our fathers.
From our younger days until today,
we have not obeyed the Lord our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Israel, if you will return, declares the Lord,
return to me.
If you remove your disgusting idols from my sight,
and do not go astray,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and if you swear, “As surely as the Lord lives,”
    in truth, justice, and righteousness,
then the nations will be blessed by him,
and they will take pride in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this is what the Lord says to the men of Judah and to Jerusalem:
Break up your unplowed ground
and do not sow among thorns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Circumcise yourselves to the Lord.
Circumcise your hearts, you men of Judah,
you who live in Jerusalem.
Otherwise my rage will burn like fire,
fire that cannot be put out,
because of the evil that you have done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Announce in Judah and proclaim in Jerusalem.
Blow the ram’s horn throughout the land.
Shout loudly and say, “Gather together!
We must flee into the fortified cities!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Raise a signal flag to flee to Zion!
Flee for safety!
Do not stay behind!
I am bringing disaster from the north.
I am bringing terrible destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A lion has come out of his den.
A destroyer of nations has set out.
He has come out of his lair to lay waste to the land.
Your cities will lie in ruins with no one living in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So put on sackcloth, mourn and wail,
because the burning anger of the Lord has not turned away from us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When that day comes, declares the Lord,
the heart of the king will fail,
and the hearts of the officials as well.
The priests will be stunned.
The prophets will be dumbfounded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I said:
Oh no, Lord God!
You have completely deceived these people
and Jerusalem as well.
You said, “You will have peace,”
but the sword is at our throats!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time it will be said to these people and to Jerusalem: “A hot wind from the bare hills in the wilderness blows toward my dear people, but not to winnow or purify.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wind too strong for that is being sent by me. Now I am passing judgment on them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look! He rises up like clouds.
His chariots are like a whirlwind.
His horses are faster than eagles!
“We are doomed! We are ruined!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jerusalem, wash the evil from your heart
    so that you will be saved.
How long will your wicked thoughts live inside you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A voice declares from Dan,
and a report of disaster comes from the hills of Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Announce this to the nations.
Make Jerusalem hear it.
A besieging army is coming from a distant land,
raising a war cry against the cities of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have surrounded her like men watching a field,
because she has rebelled against me, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way you live and the things you did have brought this on you.
This is your punishment.
It is bitter!
It strikes your heart!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My agony! My agony!
I am writhing in pain.
Oh my heart!
The walls of my heart are quivering!
I cannot keep silent,
because I hear the sound of the ram’s horn.
It is the signal for war!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One disaster after another is announced.
All the land is ruined.
Suddenly my tents are destroyed.
My tent curtains are torn apart in an instant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long must I see the battle flag
and hear the sound of the ram’s horn?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My people are fools.
They do not know me.
They are ignorant children.
They do not understand.
They are experts at doing evil,
and they do not know how to do good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I looked at the earth.
It was undeveloped and empty.
I looked at the heavens,
but there were no lights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I looked at the mountains,
and they were quaking.
All the hills were shaking.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I looked and there was no one there.
Every bird in the sky had flown away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I looked and saw that the fertile land was a wilderness.
All the cities were torn down,
because of the Lord and his burning anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says.
The land will be laid waste,
but I will not destroy it completely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of this, the earth will mourn,
and the sky above will grow dark.
I have spoken. I have made plans.
I will show no pity,
and I will not turn back from this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At the sound of riders and archers,
the people of every city will flee.
They will go off into the brush.
They will climb up into the rocks.
Every city will be abandoned.
There will not be anyone to live in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are destroyed!
What are you doing?
Why do you dress in scarlet
and put on gold jewelry?
Why do you put makeup on your eyes?
You are making yourself look beautiful for nothing.
Your lovers reject you.
They seek your life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen, I hear a cry like that of a woman in labor,
a cry of pain like that of a woman giving birth to her first child,
the cry of the daughter of Zion gasping for breath,
stretching out her hands and saying,
“Oh no, it is hopeless!
My life is slipping away in the presence of murderers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hurry here and there through the streets of Jerusalem.
Look and take note.
Search her public squares.
See if you can find just one person who deals justly
and who seeks to be faithful.
If you can, I will forgive her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though they say, “As surely as the Lord lives,”
they are still swearing falsely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, don’t your eyes look for faithfulness?
You struck them,
but they felt no pain.
You crushed them,
but they refused discipline.
They made their faces harder than rock
and refused to repent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I said:
    These are only the poor.
    They are foolish,
    because they do not know the way of the Lord
    and the just verdict of their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will go to the great men and speak to them.
    Certainly they know the way of the Lord,
    the just verdict of their God.
    But all of them together have broken the yoke
    and have torn off their chains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That is why a lion from the forest will strike them.
    A wolf from the desert will attack them,
    and a leopard is watching their cities.
    Everyone who comes out of them will be torn to pieces
    because their rebellions are so many,
    and their unfaithfulness is so great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why should I forgive you?
Your children have abandoned me
and sworn by gods that are not gods.
I satisfied their needs,
yet they committed adultery
and crowded into prostitutes’ houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are well-fed, lusty stallions,
each one neighing for his neighbor’s wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Should I not punish them for this? declares the Lord.
Should I not avenge myself on a nation like this one?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Go through her vineyards and destroy them,
but do not destroy them completely.
Cut away the branches,
because they do not belong to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The house of Israel and the house of Judah
    have been completely unfaithful to me, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have lied about the Lord.
They say, “He is nothing.
No disaster will come upon us.
We will not see sword or famine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The prophets are only wind.
The word is not in them,
so let what they say come upon them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore this is what the Lord, the God of Armies, says.
Because they have said this,
I will make my words in your mouth a fire.
These people are the wood, and it will burn them up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now, O house of Israel, I am bringing against you
    a nation from far away, declares the Lord.
I am bringing an enduring nation, an ancient nation.
They are a nation whose language you do not know,
nor can you understand what they say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their quiver is like an open grave.
They are all strong warriors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will consume your harvest and your bread.
They will consume your sons and daughters.
They will consume your flocks and herds,
and they will consume your vines and fig trees.
With their swords they will beat down your fortified cities,
the places in which you trust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet even in those days, declares the Lord, I will not destroy you completely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the people ask, “Why has the Lord our God done this to us?” answer them, “Just as you have forsaken me and served foreign gods in your own land, so now you will serve foreigners in a land that is not your own.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Declare this to the house of Jacob!
Proclaim it in Judah!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear this, you foolish, senseless people!
You have eyes but you cannot see.
You have ears but you cannot hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do you not fear me? declares the Lord.
Do you not tremble before me?
I made sand as the boundary for the sea,
a permanent barrier that it cannot cross.
The waves toss back and forth,
but they cannot get past it.
The towering waves crash,
but they cannot pass over it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But this people has a stubborn and rebellious heart.
They have turned aside and wandered away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They do not say to themselves,
“We should fear the Lord our God,
who sends autumn rains and spring rains at the right time,
who reserves for us enough weeks for the harvest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But your guilty actions have kept these things at a distance.
Your sins have kept these good things away from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wicked men are found among my people.
Like men who trap birds, they lie in wait for my people
    to set traps and catch people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like a cage full of birds, their houses are full of deceit.
That is how they became powerful and rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have become fat and sleek.
They have gone beyond evil words.
They do not argue a case for the fatherless to help them win,
and they do not seek justice for the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Should I not punish them for these things? declares the Lord.
Should I not avenge myself on a nation like this one?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A terrible thing has taken place.
A horrible thing has happened in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Prophets prophesy lies,
priests rule by their own authority,
and my people love this.
But what will you do in the end?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Flee for safety, people of Benjamin!
Get out of Jerusalem!
Blow the ram’s horn in Tekoa.
Raise a signal over Beth Hakkerem!
Disaster and great destruction threaten from the north.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will silence the beautiful, pampered daughter of Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shepherds and their flocks will come against her.
They will pitch their tents all around.
Each one will pasture his flock in his own spot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Consecrate yourselves for war against her.
Rise up, we will attack at noon!
We are doomed! The day is ending.
The evening shadows are getting longer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We should get up and attack at night
and destroy its citadels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord of Armies says.
Cut down her trees.
Raise a siege ramp against Jerusalem.
This city must be punished.
There is nothing but oppression inside her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Just as a well pours out fresh water,
she pours out fresh evil.
Violence and destruction are heard in her.
Sickness and wounds are always before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be warned, Jerusalem,
or I will turn away from you.
I will make your land desolate,
so that no one can live there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord of Armies says.
They will glean what remains of Israel
    as thoroughly as a vine.
Like someone gathering grapes,
pass your hand over the branches again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who can I speak to?
Who will listen to my warning?
Look! Their ears are uncircumcised.
They will not be able to hear.
Indeed, to them the word of the Lord is an embarrassment.
They take no pleasure in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am full of the Lord’s wrath,
and I cannot hold it in.
Pour it out on the children in the street
and on the young men gathered together.
Both husband and wife will be taken,
the old along with the very old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their houses will be turned over to others,
together with their fields and their wives,
because I will stretch out my hand against those who live in the land,
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the least of them to the greatest,
all of them are greedy for gain.
From prophets to priests, they all practice deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have treated the wound of my people as if it were nothing serious.
They say, “Peace, peace,” but there is no peace!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Are they ashamed of the detestable things they have done?
No, they are not ashamed at all!
They do not know how to be ashamed.
So they will fall with the fallen.
They will be thrown down when I punish them, says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says.
Stand at the crossroads and look.
Ask about the ancient paths.
Ask where the good road is.
Walk in it, and you will find rest for your souls.
But you said, “We will not walk in it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I set watchmen over you and said,
“Listen to the sound of the ram’s horn!”
But you said, “We will not listen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, listen, you nations!
You witnesses, observe what will happen to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen, O earth.
I am bringing disaster on this people,
the fruit of their schemes,
because they have not listened to my words,
and they have rejected my law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What use to me is incense from Sheba
or sweet cane from a distant land?
Your burnt offerings are not appealing to me.
Your sacrifices do not please me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore this is what the Lord says.
Look, I am going to place obstacles in front of this people.
Parents and children alike will stumble over them.
Friends and neighbors will perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says.
Look, a nation is coming from a land in the north.
A great nation is stirring from the farthest parts of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Its warriors grip bows and spears.
They are cruel and merciless.
They sound like the roaring sea.
They ride horses, arranged like soldiers ready for battle
    against you, O daughter of Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We have heard the news about them,
and our hands hang limp.
Anguish grips us like a woman in labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not go out to the field.
Do not walk on the road,
because the enemy has a sword.
There is terror on every side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Put on sackcloth, daughter of my people.
Roll in ashes.
Mourn as you would for an only son,
because suddenly the destroyer will come upon us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have made you like someone who tests metals.
My people are the ore that is being tested.
Observe them,
and examine their ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are all stubborn rebels,
walking in slander.
They are as hard as bronze and iron,
and all of them are contaminated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The bellows blows hot to melt away the refining agent with fire.
The refining agent is completely used up, but the evil is not removed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are classified as rejected silver,
because the Lord has rejected them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Stand in the gate of the House of the Lord and proclaim this message there.
Hear the word of the Lord, all you people of Judah who are coming through this gate to worship the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord of Armies, the God of Israel, says.
Reform your ways and your actions, and I will establish you in this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not trust in deceptive words and say, “This is the temple of the Lord, the temple of the Lord, the temple of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sincerely reform your ways and your actions. Carry out justice between a man and his neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not oppress the alien who lives in your land, the fatherless, or the widow. Do not shed innocent blood in this place. Do not follow after other gods to your own harm. If you avoid these things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will let you live in this place, in the land I gave your fathers forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take warning. You are trusting in deceptive words that cannot help you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will you steal and murder, commit adultery and swear falsely? Will you offer sacrifices to Baal and follow other gods you do not know?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will you come and stand before me in this temple that bears my Name, and say, “We are safe,” the whole time you do all these detestable things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This house bears my Name! Have you made it a den of robbers? Watch out! I myself have been watching, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go to my place in Shiloh, where I first made a dwelling place for my Name. See what I did to it because of the wickedness of my people Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have done all these things, declares the Lord. Even though I spoke to you again and again, you did not listen. I called you, but you did not answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of this, what I did to Shiloh I will now do to the house that bears my Name—the place in which you trust, the place I gave to you and to your fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will drive you out of my sight just as I drove away all of your brothers, the people of Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for you, Jeremiah, do not pray for this people or lift up a cry or a request for them, and do not plead with me. I will not listen to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not see what they are doing in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children gather wood, the fathers light a fire, and their wives knead dough to make cakes for the Queen of Heaven. They pour out drink offerings to other gods to make me angry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Am I the one they are frustrating? declares the Lord. No, they are frustrating themselves, to their own shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore this is what the Lord God says. You may be sure that my burning anger will be poured out on this place, on man and beast, on the trees of the field, and on the fruit of the land. It will burn and not be put out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord of Armies, the God of Israel, says. Go ahead. Grab your burnt offerings, along with your other sacrifices, and eat the meat yourselves!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I brought your fathers out of Egypt, I said nothing to them about burnt offerings and sacrifices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I gave them only this command: “Obey my voice, and I will be your God, and you will be my people. Walk entirely in the way I commanded you to walk, so that it may go well with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they did not obey me or listen to me. They followed their own advice and the stubbornness of their evil hearts. They went backward and not forward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the time your fathers left Egypt until today, I have sent all my servants, the prophets, to them again and again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they did not obey me or listen to me. They were stiff-necked and did more evil than their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So say all these things to them, but they will not listen to you. Call to them, but they will not answer you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say to them, “This is the nation that did not obey the Lord its God or accept discipline. Faithfulness has perished, and it has disappeared from their lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cut off your hair and throw it away. Sing a lament on the barren heights, for the Lord has rejected and forsaken this generation under his wrath.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of Judah have committed evil in my sight, declares the Lord. They set up their disgusting idols in the house that bears my Name, and they have defiled it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They built the high places of Topheth in the Valley of Ben Hinnom to burn their sons and daughters in the fire—a thing I did not command, nor did it enter my mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That is why the days are coming, declares the Lord, when that place will no longer be called Topheth or the Valley of Ben Hinnom, but the Valley of Slaughter, for they will bury the dead in Topheth because there will be no other place left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The corpses of those people will become food for the birds in the sky and the wild animals in the land, and there will be no one to frighten them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem, I will bring the sounds of joy and happiness to an end, as well as the voices of groom and bride, for the land will become desolate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time, declares the Lord, the bones of the kings of Judah, the bones of its officials, the bones of the priests, the bones of the prophets, and the bones of the people who live in Jerusalem will be removed from their graves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will be exposed to the sun, to the moon, and to all the army of the heavens, which they loved and served and followed and consulted and worshipped. They will not be gathered up again. They will not be reburied. They will lie on the ground like manure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Death will be chosen rather than life for the entire remnant left from this evil family, wherever I banish them, declares the Lord of Armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are to tell them that this is what the Lord says:
Do people fall and not get up again?
If a person turns away, doesn’t he turn back again?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then why has this people turned away?
Why is Jerusalem always turning away?
They hang on to deception
and refuse to let it go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have paid attention and listened,
but they do not say what is right.
No one repents of his wickedness.
No one asks, “What have I done?”
Everyone pursues his own course,
    like a horse charging into battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even the stork in the sky knows her seasons.
The turtledove, the swift, and the thrush
    observe the right time for their migration.
But my people do not recognize
    the just judgments of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How can you say, “We are wise,
and the law of the Lord is with us,”
when in reality the lying pen of the scribes
    has changed it into a lie?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your wise men will be put to shame.
They will be shattered and captured.
Since they have rejected the word of the Lord,
what kind of wisdom do they have?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That is why I will give their wives to other men
and their fields to new owners,
because, from the least to the greatest,
all of them are greedy for gain.
From prophet to priest, everyone practices deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They dress the wound of the daughter of my people
    as if it were not serious.
“Peace, peace,” they say,
when there is no peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Are they ashamed when they do such a detestable thing?
No, they have no shame at all.
They do not even know how to blush.
That is why they will fall among the fallen.
They will be brought down when I punish them, says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will take away their harvest, declares the Lord.
There will be no grapes on the vine.
There will be no figs on the fig tree,
and the leaves will wither.
What I have given them will be taken away from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why are we just sitting here?
Let’s get together!
Let us go into the fortified cities and die there.
The Lord our God has condemned us to die
    by giving us poisoned water to drink,
    because we have sinned against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We hoped for peace,
but no good came.
We hoped for a time of healing,
but there is only terror.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The snorting of horses is heard from Dan.
At the sound of the neighing of mighty stallions,
    the whole land trembles.
They have come to devour the land and everything in it,
    the city and all who live there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, I am sending snakes among you,
venomous snakes that cannot be charmed,
and they will bite you, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My joy is gone, grief is upon me,
and my heart is sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I hear the cry of my dear people from a distant land:
“Is the Lord not in Zion?
Is her King not there?”
Why have they provoked my anger with their carved images,
with their worthless foreign idols?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The harvest is past,
summer has ended,
and we have not been saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because my people are crushed, I have been crushed.
I am in mourning, and horror seizes me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is there no balm in Gilead?
Is there no physician there?
Why has the health of my people not been restored?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I wish my head were a spring of water
and my eyes a fountain of tears.
Then I would weep day and night
    for the fallen of my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I wish there was a lodging place for travelers
in the wilderness.
Then I would leave my people
and get away from them.
They are all adulterers,
a society of traitors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They bend their tongues like bows, to deceive.
It is not by faithfulness that they prevail in the land.
They go from evil to evil,
and they do not acknowledge me,
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Everyone should be on guard against his friend.
Do not trust any brother,
for every brother is really a deceiver,
and every friend spreads slander.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Everyone betrays his friend,
and no one speaks the truth.
They have taught their tongues to lie.
They wear themselves out with sinning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You, Jeremiah, live in the midst of deception!
In their deceit they refuse to acknowledge me,
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore this is what the Lord of Armies says.
Watch me. I will refine them and test them.
What else can I do for my dear people?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their tongues are like deadly arrows.
They speak deceitfully.
With their mouths they speak peacefully to their neighbors,
but in their hearts they set traps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shall I not punish them for these things? declares the Lord.
Shall I not avenge myself on such a nation as this?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will cry and sob for the mountains.
I will sing a lament for the pastures in the wilderness.
They are desolate and untraveled,
and not even the lowing of cattle is heard.
From the birds in the sky to all the animals below, everything has fled.
They are all gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will make Jerusalem a heap of ruins, a jackals’ den,
and I am going to lay waste to the cities of Judah,
so that no one can live there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who is wise enough to understand this? Who has been instructed by the Lord so that he can explain it? Why is the land ruined and laid waste like a wilderness, so that no one can pass through it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord said:
This happened because they have forsaken my law, which I set before them. They did not listen to my voice or live according to it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, they followed the stubbornness of their hearts, and they have followed the Baals as their fathers taught them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, this is what the Lord of Armies, the God of Israel, says. Watch me. I am going to make this people eat wormwood and drink bitter water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will scatter them among nations that they and their fathers have not known, and I will pursue them with the sword until I have destroyed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord of Armies says.
Consider this, and call for the wailing women.
Send for those who are the most skilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They should hurry and sob over us.
Our eyes will run with tears.
Our eyelids will stream with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sound of sobbing is heard from Zion.
“We are ruined!
We are so ashamed!
We must leave our land
because they have torn down our dwellings.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to the word of the Lord, you women.
Pay attention to the word from his mouth.
Teach your daughters how to sob.
Each of you should teach her neighbor a lament.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Death has climbed in through a window
and entered our citadels.
It has taken away the children from the streets
and the young men from the city squares.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says.
Dead bodies will fall
like manure on the ground,
like freshly cut grain after the reaper,
with no one to gather it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says.
The wise man should not boast in his wisdom.
The strong man should not boast in his strength,
nor the rich man in his riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Instead, let those who boast boast about this:
that they have understanding, and that they know me.
They know that I am the Lord,
who shows mercy, justice, and righteousness on earth,
for I delight in these things, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch! The days are coming, declares the Lord, when I will punish all those who are circumcised only in the flesh—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Egypt, Judah, Edom, Ammon, Moab, and all who cut their hair short and who live in the wilderness. Actually, these are all uncircumcised nations. And the whole house of Israel is uncircumcised in their hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear the word that the Lord is speaking to you, house of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says.
Do not learn the ways of the nations,
or be frightened by signs in the heavens,
although the nations are frightened by them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The rituals of the peoples are worthless.
They cut down a tree in the forest.
Then the hands of a craftsman work it with an ax.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They decorate it with silver and gold,
but they have to nail it down with hammers,
    so that it will not tip over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their idols are like a scarecrow in a melon patch.
They cannot speak.
They must be carried because they cannot walk.
Do not fear them. They can do no harm,
nor can they do any good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No one is like you, Lord.
You are great and your name is powerful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is there anyone who should not fear you, King of the Nations?
That is what you deserve.
Among all the wise men of the nations
and in all their kingdoms,
there is no one like you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are stupid and foolish,
because they are instructed by worthless idols made of wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hammered silver is brought from Tarshish,
and gold is brought from Uphaz.
The handiwork of a goldsmith
and the work of a craftsman,
their idols are dressed in blue and purple.
But they are nothing but the work of skilled craftsmen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the Lord is the true God.
He is the living God, the eternal King.
The earth quakes at his wrath.
The nations cannot endure his fury.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are to say this to them:
“These gods, who did not make the heavens and the earth,
    will perish from the earth and from under the heavens.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the one who made the earth by his power,
    established the world by his wisdom,
    and stretched out the heavens by his understanding—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he thunders, and the waters in the heavens roar.
He makes storm clouds rise from the ends of the earth.
He makes lightning for the rain,
and he brings out the wind from his warehouses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as for mankind, they are all stupid.
Their knowledge has dried up.
Every goldsmith is embarrassed by his idols.
The images he makes are false.
There is no breath in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are worthless,
an achievement to be mocked.
At the time of their punishment, they will perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who is the Portion of Jacob is not like these,
because he is the Maker of all things,
including Israel, the tribe that belongs to him.
The Lord of Armies is his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pick up your pack from the ground,
you who live under siege.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this is what the Lord says.
Watch, I am going to throw out those who live in the land at this time.
I am going to bring them distress that they will feel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to me because of my wound!
My injury is severe!
But I said, “Yes, this is my suffering,
and I must bear it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My tent is destroyed.
All its ropes are broken.
My children are gone, and they are no more.
No one is left to pitch my tent
or to set up my dwelling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The shepherds have become as senseless as animals.
They do not seek the Lord.
That is why they do not prosper
and all their flock is scattered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen! I hear noise—
a great commotion from a land in the north.
It will make the cities of Judah desolate.
It will make them a haunt for jackals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I know, Lord, that a man’s way is not his own,
nor can a man direct his own steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Correct me, Lord, but with justice,
not in your anger,
or you will reduce me to nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pour out your wrath on the nations who do not acknowledge you,
on the peoples who do not call on your name,
for they have devoured Jacob.
They have devoured him completely
and made his homeland desolate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen to the terms of this covenant, and announce them to every man in Judah and to those who live in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell them that this is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says. A curse on the man who does not obey the terms of this covenant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the terms I commanded your fathers when I brought them out of the land of Egypt, out of the iron-smelting furnace. I said, “Obey me and do everything that I command you, and you will be my people, and I will be your God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I will ratify the oath I swore to your fathers, that I would give them a land flowing with milk and honey—as it is today.
I answered, “Amen, Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord then told me to proclaim all these words in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem.
Listen to the terms of this covenant and obey them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the time when I brought your fathers out of the land of Egypt until today, I have warned them again and again to obey my voice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but they did not obey. They did not pay attention. Each one lived according to the stubbornness of his own evil heart. So I brought all the curses of this covenant on them. I commanded them to obey, but they did not obey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord also said to me:
A conspiracy has been uncovered among the men of Judah and those who live in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have returned to the sins of their fathers, who refused to obey my words. They are following other gods and serving them. The house of Israel and the house of Judah have broken the covenant I made with their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore this is what the Lord says. Watch this. I am going to bring a disaster on them that they will not be able to escape. They will cry out to me, but I will not listen to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the cities of Judah and those who live in Jerusalem will cry out to the gods to whom they have been burning offerings, but who cannot do anything to save them in the time of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judah, you have as many gods as you have towns. You have set up as many altars to burn offerings to Shame—that is, to Baal—as there are streets in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for you, Jeremiah, do not pray for this people or lift up a cry or a request for them. I will not listen to them when they call to me in their time of distress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She is my beloved, but what right does she have to be in my temple when she has done so many wicked things? Can consecrated meat prevent you from being punished if you rejoice when you do evil?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord called you a green olive tree with beautifully formed fruit. But with the roar of a mighty storm he will set it ablaze, and its branches will be broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord of Armies, who planted you, has decreed disaster for you because of the evil that the house of Israel and the house of Judah have done. They have provoked me to anger by burning incense to Baal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord revealed their plot to me so I became aware of it. He showed me what they were doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I was like a gentle lamb led to the slaughter. I had not realized that they had plotted against me. They were saying:
“Let us destroy the tree along with its fruit.
Let us cut him off from the land of the living,
so that his name will no longer be remembered.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But, Lord of Armies, you judge righteously.
You test the heart and mind.
Let me see your vengeance on them,
    for I have presented my case to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore this is what the Lord says concerning the men of Anathoth who are seeking your life and saying, “Do not prophesy in the name of the Lord, or you will die by our hands.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord of Armies says. I will certainly punish them. Their young men will die by the sword. Their sons and daughters will die by famine,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and none of them will be left. I will bring disaster on the men of Anathoth, the year of their punishment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, you are righteous whenever I bring a case before you.
Nevertheless, I want to speak with you about justice.
Why does the way of the wicked prosper?
Why do the treacherous live at ease?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You plant them, and they take root.
They grow, and they produce fruit.
You are always on their lips,
but far from their hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you know me, Lord.
You see me and test the attitude of my heart toward you.
Drag them away like sheep for the slaughter,
and set them apart for the day when they will be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will the land mourn,
and the grass in the whole countryside wither?
Because of the evil of the people who live there,
the animals and birds are dying,
for the people have said,
“He will not see how things turn out for us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you have raced men on foot
and they have tired you out,
how will you compete against horses?
If you fall in open country,
how will you manage in the thickets along the Jordan?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your relatives and the members of your father’s
    household have betrayed you.
They have raised a loud outcry against you.
Do not trust them when they speak friendly words to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have abandoned my house.
I have forsaken my heritage.
I have given the one I love dearly into the hands of her enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My heritage has become like a lion in the forest to me.
She roars at me, so I hate her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For me my heritage has become like a howling hyena,
    surrounded by scavenging birds of prey.
Go and gather all the wild animals.
Bring them to devour her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many shepherds have destroyed my vineyard
and trampled down my estate.
They will turn my pleasant estate into a desolate wasteland.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have made it a wasteland.
It mourns. It is desolate before me.
The whole land is laid waste,
because there is no one who cares.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Looters are swarming over all the barren heights in the wilderness.
The Lord has a sword that devours from one end of the land
        to the other.
No one will be safe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They plant wheat, but they reap thorns.
They wear themselves out, but they gain nothing.
Be ashamed of your harvests,
because of the burning anger of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord says. As for my wicked neighbors, who seize the inheritance I gave my people Israel, I will certainly uproot them from their homeland, and I will uproot the house of Judah from among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After I have uprooted them, I will once again have compassion on them. I will return each of them to his own inheritance and each of them to his own land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If they carefully learn the ways of my people and swear by my name, saying, “As surely as the Lord lives” (just as they once taught my people to swear by Baal), then they will be established among my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they do not listen, I will completely uproot and destroy that nation, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord said to me: “Go and purchase a linen undergarment for yourself. Put it around your waist. Do not let it touch water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I bought an undergarment as the Lord said, and I put it on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to me a second time:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take the undergarment you purchased, the one you are wearing around your waist, and go right now to Perath and hide it there in a cleft in the rocks.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I went and hid it at Perath, as the Lord commanded me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many days later the Lord said to me, “Go to Perath and retrieve the undergarment I told you to hide there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I went to Perath and searched. I took the undergarment from the place where I had hidden it, but now it was ruined and worthless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord says. I will ruin the pride of Judah and the great pride of Jerusalem in the same way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These wicked people refuse to listen to me. They follow their own stubborn hearts. They follow after other gods by serving them and worshipping them. They are all like this worthless undergarment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as an undergarment fits tightly around a man’s waist, in the same way I made the whole house of Israel and the whole house of Judah cling to me, declares the Lord. I did this so that they would be my people and so that they would bring praise and honor to my name, but they would not listen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give this message to them.
This is what the Lord God of Israel says: “Every clay jar will be filled with wine.” Then they will say to you, “We know that every clay jar will be filled with wine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So say to them, “This is what the Lord says. I will certainly make everyone who lives in this land drunk. The kings who sit on David’s throne, the priests, the prophets, and all those who live in Jerusalem will become drunk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I will smash them to pieces—a man against his brother, fathers, and sons, declares the Lord. I will not spare them. I will destroy them without pity or compassion.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen and pay attention!
Do not be arrogant, for the Lord has spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Honor the Lord your God before he brings darkness,
and before your feet stumble on the mountains at dusk.
You will look for light,
but he will turn it into the shadow of death
and change it into deep darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you will not listen,
I will cry for you in secret because of your arrogance.
My eyes will weep bitterly and overflow with tears,
because the Lord’s flock will be taken captive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Say to the king and to the queen mother,
“Come down from your thrones,
because your crowns will fall from your heads.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The cities of the Negev are under siege,
and no one can get through to them.
All of Judah will be taken into exile.
They will be carried away completely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look up and see those who are coming from the north.
Where is the flock entrusted to you,
the sheep you were so proud of?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What will you say when associates whom you yourself have taught are appointed as masters over you? Won’t pain seize you like a woman in labor?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you ask yourself, “Why has this happened to me?” you should know that it is because of your great guilt that your skirt has been torn off, and you have been violated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can an Ethiopian change the color of his skin?
Can a leopard change its spots?
Just as little can you, who are disciples of evil, do good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will scatter you like chaff blown by the desert wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is your lot.
This is what I have assigned to you,
declares the Lord.
This will take place because you have forgotten me
and trusted in falsehood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I myself will lift your skirt over your head,
so that your shame can be seen—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
your adulteries, your lust-filled neighing,
and your shameless prostitution.
I have seen your detestable acts on the hills and in the countryside.
Woe to you, Jerusalem!
You are unclean.
After this, will you ever be clean again?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the word of the Lord that came to Jeremiah concerning the drought.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Judah mourns.
Her city gates fall apart.
They mourn for the land,
and a cry of grief rises from Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The strong send the weak to get water.
They go to the cisterns but find no water.
They return with empty containers.
Ashamed and humiliated, they cover their heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The ground is cracked,
because there has been no rain in the land.
The farmers are distressed.
They cover their heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even the doe in the field gives birth
and then abandons the fawn,
because there is no grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wild donkeys stand on the barren heights.
They pant for air like jackals.
Their eyes grow dim,
because there are no plants to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do something, Lord, for the sake of your name,
    even though our guilt testifies against us.
    We have rebelled many times,
    and we have sinned against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are Israel’s hope,
    its Savior in times of trouble.
    Why are you like a stranger in the land,
    like a traveler who stays only for the night?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why are you like a man taken by surprise,
    like a strong warrior who cannot save?
    You are among us, Lord,
    and we are called by your name.
    Do not forsake us!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says concerning this people.
    They love to wander!
    They never restrain their feet.
    So the Lord does not accept them.
    Instead, he will remember their guilt
    and punish their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told me, “Do not pray for the well-being of these people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even if they fast, I will not listen to their cries for help. Even if they sacrifice burnt offerings and grain offerings, I will not accept them. Instead, I will finish them off with sword, famine, and plague.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said, “But, Lord God, the prophets keep telling them, ‘You will not see sword or famine. I will give you lasting peace in this place.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord said this to me:
Those prophets are prophesying lies in my name, but I did not send them. I did not command them, and I did not speak to them. They are prophesying a false vision to you and providing worthless omens—something from their own imagination.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, this is what the Lord says about the prophets who prophesy lies in my name. I did not send them. They say that there will be no sword or famine in this land, but by sword and famine those prophets will die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people to whom they are prophesying will be thrown out into the streets of Jerusalem because of famine and the sword. No one will bury them—them, their wives, their sons, or their daughters. I will pour out on them the destruction that they deserve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You, Jeremiah, are to say this to them:
Let my eyes overflow with tears,
without stopping night or day,
because the virgin daughter of my people has been severely injured.
It is a very serious wound.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I go out to the field,
I see those who have been run through by the sword.
If go into the city,
I see those diseased by famine.
Both prophet and priest have gone to a land they do not know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, have you completely rejected Judah?
Do you despise Zion?
Why have you afflicted us,
so that we cannot be healed?
We looked for health,
but nothing good came.
We hoped for healing,
but there was only terror.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We acknowledge our wickedness
and the guilt of our fathers.
We have sinned against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For your name’s sake, do not despise us.
Do not dishonor your glorious throne.
Remember your covenant with us,
and do not break it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do the worthless idols of the nations send rain?
Do the skies provide the torrential showers?
Is it not rather you, who are the Lord our God?
Our hope is in you,
because you are the one who does all these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord said to me:
Even if Moses and Samuel were standing in front of me, my heart would not go out to this people. Send them away from me. Let them go!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When they ask you, “Where should we go?” tell them that this is what the Lord says:
Those doomed to death, to death,
those doomed to the sword, to the sword,
those doomed to famine, to famine,
those doomed to captivity, to captivity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will punish them in four ways, declares the Lord: The sword will kill, and dogs will drag them away. The birds in the sky and the wild animals in the land will devour and destroy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make them an object of horror to all the kingdoms of the earth because of what Manasseh son of Hezekiah, king of Judah, did in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who will have pity on you, Jerusalem?
Who will mourn for you?
Who will turn back to ask how you are?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have rejected me, declares the Lord.
You have turned away from me.
So I will stretch out my hand against you and destroy you.
I am weary of showing compassion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will scatter them with a winnowing fork at the gates of the land.
I will make them childless.
I will destroy my people,
because they have not changed their ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will make their widows more numerous than the sand on the seashore.
At noon I will bring a destroyer against the mothers of their
        young men.
I will bring anguish and terror down on them suddenly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mother of seven will grow faint.
She will breathe her last.
Her sun will set while it is still day,
and she will be ashamed and humiliated.
The survivors I will put to the sword in the presence of their enemies,
        declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am so miserable, my mother, that you gave birth to me.
I am the man with whom the whole land argues and quarrels.
I have not lent or borrowed, but everyone curses me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord said:
I will surely set you free for your own good.
I will surely make your enemies plead with you
in a time of trouble and in a time of distress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can anyone break iron—iron from the north—or bronze?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give away your wealth and your treasures as plunder, without cost, because of all your sins throughout all your territory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make you serve your enemies in a land you do not know, for my anger is kindled in me, and you will burn continuously.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, you understand.
Remember me and care for me.
Take vengeance for me on those who persecute me.
You are slow to anger.
Do not take me away.
Keep in mind that for your sake I bear disgrace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your words came to me, and I devoured them.
Your words became my joy,
the delight of my heart,
because I bear your name,
O Lord God of Armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I did not sit with the band of partygoers,
nor did I celebrate with them.
I sat alone, because your hand was upon me.
You filled me with indignation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why is my pain unending?
Why is my wound incurable, refusing to heal?
Will you be as deceptive as an intermittent stream to me,
like a source of water that a person can’t depend on?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore this is what the Lord says.
If you repent, I will take you back,
so that you may stand before me.
If what you say is worthwhile and not worthless,
you will be my spokesman.
They must turn to you,
but you must not turn to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will make you like a bronze wall to this people.
They will fight against you,
but they will not overcome you,
because I am with you to save you
and to rescue you, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will rescue you from the hand of the wicked,
and I will deliver you from the grasp of the ruthless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are not to marry a wife in this place
or to have sons and daughters,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because this is what the Lord says
    about the sons and daughters born in this place,
about the mothers who bore them,
and about the fathers who conceived them in this land:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will die of deadly diseases.
    They will not be mourned.
    They will not be buried.
    They will lie on the ground like manure.
    They will be devoured by sword and famine,
    and their carcasses will become food for the birds in the sky
    and the wild animals in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says.
Do not enter a house where people are grieving.
Do not go there to mourn for anyone or to comfort anyone,
for I have taken away my peace from this people, declares the Lord,
along with my mercy and my compassion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Both the greatest and the least will die in this land.
No one will bury them or mourn for them.
No one will cut himself or shave himself for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No one will break bread to comfort those who mourn the dead.
No one will offer a consoling cup, even for a father or a mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not enter a house where there is feasting,
or sit down there to eat and drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this is what the Lord of Armies, the God of Israel, says.
I will certainly put an end to the sounds of joy and happiness in this place,
as well as the voices of bride and groom.
This will take place before your eyes and in your lifetime.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you tell the people all of this, they will ask you, “Why has the Lord decreed all this great disaster against us? What are we guilty of? What sin have we committed against the Lord our God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then say this to them:
It is because your fathers abandoned me, declares the Lord, and followed other gods. They served them, and they worshipped them. They abandoned me and did not keep my law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you have done more evil than your fathers. Look, each of you follows his own stubborn, evil heart, and you do not listen to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, I will throw you out of this land into a land neither you nor your fathers have known. There you will serve other gods day and night, and I will show you no mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, listen to this. The days are coming, declares the Lord, when people will no longer say, “As surely as the Lord lives, who brought the children of Israel out from the land of Egypt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they will say, “As surely as the Lord lives, who brought the children of Israel out from the land in the north and from all the lands to which he exiled them.” For I will restore them to the homeland I gave to their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look, I am sending for many fishermen, declares the Lord, and they will catch them. After that I will send for many hunters, and they will hunt for them on every mountain, on every high hill, and in the crevices of the rocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My eyes are watching everything they do. It is not hidden from me, nor is their guilt hidden from my eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But first I will pay them double for their guilt and their sin, because they defiled my land with the carcasses of their disgusting idols, and they have filled my inheritance with their abominations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is my strength and my fortress,
my refuge in times of trouble.
Nations will come to you from the ends of the earth and say,
“Our forefathers possessed only false gods,
worthless idols, and there was nothing good in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can a man make gods for himself?
Yes, but they are not gods!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore I will certainly teach them.
This time I will teach them my power and my strength,
and then they will know that my name is the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Judah’s sin is written with an iron stylus.
It is engraved with a diamond tip on the tablet of their hearts
and on the horns of their altars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even their children remember their altars and their Asherah poles,
beside every green tree on the high hills,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and on the mountains in the countryside.
I will turn all your wealth into plunder
because of the sin you committed on the high places
    throughout all your territory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will lose your inheritance that I gave you,
and I will make you serve your enemies in a land you do not know.
You have started a fire in my anger that will burn forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says.
Cursed is anyone who trusts in mankind,
who seeks his strength from human flesh,
and who turns his heart away from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will be like a juniper bush in the wasteland.
He will not see good things when they come.
He lives in a dry place in the wilderness,
in a salty land where no one lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But blessed is anyone who trusts in the Lord,
whose confidence is in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will be like a tree planted by water.
It sends out its roots to the stream.
It does not fear the heat when it comes.
Its leaves will remain green.
It is not concerned about a time of drought.
It does not stop producing fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heart is more deceitful than anything.
It is beyond cure.
Who can understand it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I, the Lord, am the one who searches the heart
and examines the mind,
    to reward a man according to what he has done,
