    according to what his deeds deserve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who accumulate a fortune unjustly
    are like a partridge that hatches eggs it did not lay.
Midway through life their fortune will be lost,
and in the end they will be exposed as fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The place of our sanctuary is a glorious throne,
    exalted from the beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are the hope of Israel, Lord.
All who forsake you will be put to shame.
Those who turn away from you will be written in the earth,
because they have forsaken the Lord, the spring of living water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Heal me, Lord, and I will be healed.
Save me, and I will be saved,
for you are the one I praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They say to me,
“Where is the word of the Lord? Let it come!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have not tried to run away from being your shepherd,
nor have I wanted to bring the day of incurable pain.
You are aware of everything that comes out of my lips.
It is not hidden from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not be a terror to me.
You are my refuge in the day of disaster.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let my persecutors be put to shame,
but do not let me be put to shame.
Let them be terrified,
but do not let me be terrified.
Bring on them the day of disaster
and destroy them with double destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord told me.
Go and stand at the Gate of the People, through which the kings of Judah enter and leave, and in all the gates of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Tell them this message.
Hear the word of the Lord, you kings of Judah, all of Judah, and all who live in Jerusalem, and all who enter by these gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord says. Protect your lives. Do not carry a load of things on the Sabbath day or bring it through the gates of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not carry a load out of your houses on the Sabbath day. Do not do any work, but keep the Sabbath day holy as I commanded your fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they did not listen or pay attention. They became stiff-necked so that they would not hear or receive instruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, if you listen carefully to me, declares the Lord, and if you do not carry any load through the gates of the city on the Sabbath day, but you instead keep the Sabbath day holy and do not do any work,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then kings who sit on David’s throne and their officials will enter in through the gates of this city, riding in chariots and on horses, along with the men of Judah and with those who live in Jerusalem. They will live in this city forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will come from the cities of Judah, from the places around Jerusalem, from the land of Benjamin, from the Shephelah, from the hill country, and from the Negev. They will bring burnt offerings, sacrifices, fellowship offerings, incense, and thank offerings to the House of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you will not listen to me and do not keep the Sabbath day holy, and you enter the gates of Jerusalem carrying a load on the Sabbath day, then I will set fire to its gates. I will burn the public buildings of Jerusalem, and the fire will not be put out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Get up, and go down to the potter’s house, and there I will reveal my words to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I went down to the potter’s house, and he was making something on the wheel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the pot he was forming out of the clay was ruined as he shaped it with his hands, so the potter formed it into a different pot, whatever he saw fit to make.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: House of Israel, can I not do with you as this potter does? declares the Lord. See, like clay in the potter’s hands, that is what you are in my hands, house of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One time I may say that a nation or a kingdom is to be uprooted, torn down, and destroyed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but if that nation I spoke about repents of its evil, then I will relent and not bring the disaster I had planned to bring against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Another time I may say that a nation or a kingdom is to be built and planted,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but if they do what is evil in my sight by not listening to my voice, then I will not bring about the good I said I would do for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore say this to the men of Judah and to those who live in Jerusalem. This is what the Lord says. Look! I am forming a disaster against you. I am devising a plan against you. Turn from your evil ways, each of you, and reform your ways and your actions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they will say, “It is hopeless! Each of us will always walk in the stubbornness of his own evil heart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore this is what the Lord says.
Ask among the nations,
“Who has ever heard anything like this?”
Virgin Israel has done a most terrible thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Does the snow of Lebanon ever disappear from its rocky slopes?
Does cold water flowing from a long distance ever run dry?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet my people have forgotten me.
They burn incense to false gods,
    that make them stumble in their ways,
    in the ancient paths.
They walk on side roads,
on roads not built up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They make their land something horrible,
a target of lasting contempt.
Everyone who passes by will be horrified and shake his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like the east wind I will scatter them in front of their enemies.
I will show them my back and not my face on the day of their calamity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some people said, “Come on! Let’s make plans against Jeremiah, because the law will not vanish from the priest, nor guidance from the wise, nor the word from the prophet. Come on, let’s attack him with words and pay no attention to anything he says.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to me, Lord.
Listen to what my opponents are saying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Should good be repaid with evil?
Yet they have dug a pit for me.
Remember how I stood before you to speak on their behalf,
to turn your anger from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, hand their children over to famine,
and hand them over to the power of the sword.
Let their wives become childless widows.
Let their men be put to death,
and their young men be struck in battle by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let a cry be heard from their houses
when you suddenly bring marauders against them,
because they have dug a pit to capture me
and have hidden snares for my feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you, Lord, are aware of all their plots to kill me.
Do not forgive their guilt.
Do not blot out their sin from your sight.
Let them be overthrown in your presence.
Deal with them in the time of your anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says.
Go and buy a clay jar from a potter. Take along some of the elders of the people and some of the priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go out to the Valley of Ben Hinnom, by the entrance of the Potsherd Gate. Proclaim there the words I will tell you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Say this to them:
Hear the word of the Lord, you kings of Judah and you who live in Jerusalem. This is what the Lord of Armies, the God of Israel, says.
Watch out! I am going to bring a disaster on this place that will make the ears of all who hear about it ring,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because they have forsaken me and have defiled this place. They have burned incense in it to other gods that neither they nor their fathers nor the kings of Judah ever knew. They have filled this place with the blood of the innocent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have built high places to Baal and burned their children in the fire as offerings to Baal—something I did not command or mention, and which did not enter my mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So listen to this. The days are coming, declares the Lord, when people will no longer call this place Topheth or Ben Hinnom, but the Valley of Slaughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will ruin the plans of Judah and Jerusalem in this place. I will make them fall by the sword before their enemies, at the hands of those who seek their lives. I will make their dead bodies food for the birds in the sky and the wild animals in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make this city desolate, and I will make it a target of contempt. Everyone who passes by will be horrified and scoff because of all its wounds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make them eat the flesh of their sons and daughters. They will eat one another’s flesh during the pressure from the siege that their enemies, those who want to kill them, will bring upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then break the jar in the sight of the men who are with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Tell them this is what the Lord of Armies says.
This is how I will break this people and this city, like a potter’s jar that is so smashed that it cannot be made whole again. They will bury people in Topheth until there is no place left to bury.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what I will do to this place, says the Lord, and to those who live here: I will make this city like Topheth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The houses of Jerusalem and the houses of the kings of Judah will become defiled—all the houses on whose rooftops they have burned incense to all the army of the heavens and poured out drink offerings to other gods. They will all be defiled like that place Topheth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah came back from Topheth, where the Lord had sent him to prophesy, and he stood in the courtyard of the House of the Lord and said to all the people:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what the Lord of Armies, the God of Israel, says. I will certainly bring on this city and on all its towns every disaster that I have proclaimed against it, because they have become stiff-necked, refusing to hear my words.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pashhur the priest, the son of Immer, who served as the chief officer in the House of the Lord, heard Jeremiah prophesying about these things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pashhur ordered them to beat Jeremiah the prophet, and he put him in the stocks at the Upper Benjamin Gate in the House of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day, when Pashhur released him from the stocks, Jeremiah said to him, “The Lord does not call you Pashhur, but Magor Missabib,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for this is what the Lord says: I will certainly make you a terror to yourself and to all your friends. They will fall by the sword of their enemies before your very eyes. I will hand Judah over to the king of Babylon. He will carry the people captive to Babylon, and he will strike them with the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also, the riches of this city, all its property, and all the treasures of the kings of Judah—I will give it all away into the hands of their enemies. They will plunder them, seize them, and carry them off to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for you, Pashhur, and all who live in your house, you will go into captivity. You will go to Babylon! You will die there, and you will be buried there, you and all your friends to whom you have prophesied falsely.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You persuaded me, Lord, and I agreed to it.
You are stronger than I am, and you won out.
I have become a laughingstock all day long,
and everyone is mocking me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whenever I speak, I cry out.
I cry out, “Violence and destruction!”
But the word of the Lord has brought scorn on me.
I am mocked all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I say, “I will not mention him
or speak in his name anymore,”
then there is a burning fire in my heart,
shut up in my bones,
and I am weary of holding it in.
I cannot!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I hear many whispering,
“Terror on every side!”
All my close friends,
those who are watching for my fall, say,
“Denounce him! Let’s denounce him.
Perhaps he can be pressured into making a mistake.
Then we will have the upper hand against him,
and we will take our revenge on him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the Lord is with me like a terrifying warrior.
So my persecutors will stumble,
and they will not gain the upper hand.
They will be put to shame completely,
because they have not been successful.
Their eternal disgrace will never be forgotten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord of Armies, you test the righteous.
You see the heart and the mind.
Let me see your vengeance on them,
for I have laid out my case before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to the Lord!
Praise the Lord,
for he has delivered the life of the needy
    from the hand of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the day I was born be cursed.
Do not let the day my mother gave birth to me be blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the man be cursed who brought news to my father,
“A son is born to you,”
the man who brought him great joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let that man be like the cities the Lord overthrew without pity.
Let him hear a cry in the morning,
an alarm for war at noon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because he did not put me to death in the womb,
so that my mother would have been my grave,
and her womb would have been pregnant forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why did I emerge from that womb
    to see trouble and sorrow,
    to finish my days in shame?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord when King Zedekiah sent Pashhur son of Malkijah along with Zephaniah the priest, the son of Ma’aseiah, to speak to Jeremiah. They said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Inquire of the Lord for us, because Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon is making war against us. Perhaps the Lord will perform some of his wonders on our behalf as he did in the past, so that Nebuchadnezzar will withdraw from us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Jeremiah answered them:
Tell Zedekiah that
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the Lord, the God of Israel, says this.
I will certainly turn the weapons of war in your hands against you, the ones you are using to fight against the king of Babylon and the Chaldeans, who are outside your wall besieging you. And I will bring them inside this city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I myself will fight against you with an outstretched hand and a mighty arm, with furious anger and great wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will strike those who live in this city, both man and animal. They will die of a terrible plague.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward, says the Lord, I will deliver Zedekiah king of Judah, those who serve him, and the people in this city who survive the plague, sword, and famine. I will deliver them into the hands of their enemies and into the hands of those who seek their lives. He will strike them with the sword. He will show them no compassion, no pity, and no mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell this people this is what the Lord says. I will certainly set before you the way of life and the way of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever remains in this city will die by the sword, famine, and plague, but all those who go out and surrender to the Chaldeans who are besieging you will escape with their lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have set my face against this city to bring harm and not good, says the Lord. The city will be given into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he will burn it up with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Concerning the house of the king of Judah, this is the word of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord says that you, House of David, are to administer justice in the morning and deliver the victim of robbery from the hand of the oppressor, or my wrath will flare up like fire and burn so that no one can put it out, because of the evil you have done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look, I am against you, you who live in this valley in the rocky highlands, declares the Lord. I am against you who say, “Who can come against us? Who can enter our homes?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will punish you according to what you have done, says the Lord. I will kindle a fire in the forest, and it will consume everything around you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says.
Go down to the palace of the king of Judah and speak this message there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear the word of the Lord, king of Judah, you who sit on David’s throne—you, your officials, and your people who enter these gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord says. Do what is just and right. Rescue the person who has been robbed from the hand of the oppressor. Do no wrong or violence to the foreigner, to the fatherless, or to the widow. Do not shed innocent blood in this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you diligently carry this out, then kings who sit on David’s throne will enter through the gates of this house, riding in chariots and on horses, accompanied by their officials and their people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you will not obey these words, then I swear by myself, declares the Lord, that this house will become a ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, this is what the Lord says about the house of the king of Judah.
You are like Gilead to me,
like the peak of Lebanon.
You can be sure that I will turn you into a wilderness,
like uninhabited towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will send destroyers against you,
each of them with his weapons.
They will cut down your best cedars,
and they will throw them into the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many nations will pass by this city and will ask one another, “Why did the Lord do such a thing to this great city?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the answer will be, “It is because they abandoned the covenant of the Lord their God. They worshipped other gods and served them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not weep for the dead.
Do not mourn for him,
but weep bitterly for the one who is exiled,
because he will never return.
He will never see the land of his birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is what the Lord says about Shallum son of Josiah, king of Judah, who reigned in place of his father Josiah. He has gone out from this place, but he will never return again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will die in the place where they have led him captive. He will never see this land again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to him who builds his house through unrighteousness
and his roof with injustice,
who makes his neighbors work for nothing
and does not pay them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who says, “I will build a huge mansion for myself
    with spacious upper rooms.”
He makes large windows for it,
panels it with cedar,
and paints it red.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Does it make you a king when you are extravagant with cedar?
Didn’t your father eat and drink,
and do what was just and right?
Then it went well for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He defended the cause of the poor and needy,
and it went well.
Isn’t this what it means to know me? declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore this is what the Lord says concerning
Jehoiakim son of Josiah, king of Judah:
    They will not mourn for him,
“Oh, my brother! Oh, my sister!”
They will not mourn for him,
“Oh, my master! Oh, his glory!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will be buried with the burial of a donkey—
dragged away and thrown outside the gates of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Go up to Lebanon and cry out.
Lift your voice in Bashan.
Cry out from Abarim,
because all your lovers have been destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I spoke to you when you were at peace,
but you said, “I will not listen.”
This has been your way since your youth.
You have never listened to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your shepherds will be herded by the wind.
Your lovers will go into exile.
Then you will be ashamed and humiliated because of all your evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You who live in Lebanon,
you who make your nest in the cedars,
how you will groan when pains come upon you,
pains like those of a woman in labor!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As I live, declares the Lord, even if you, Coniah son of Jehoiakim king of Judah, were a signet ring on my right hand, I would pull you off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will deliver you into the hand of those who want to take your life, those you fear. I will deliver you into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and into the hand of the Chaldeans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will throw you and the mother who bore you into another country, where neither of you were born, and there you will die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will never return to the land to which they long to return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is this man Coniah a despised broken pot?
Is he a jar no one wants?
Why are he and his children thrown out,
cast into a land they do not know?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Land, land, O land!
Hear the word of the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says.
Record this man as childless,
a man who will not prosper in his lifetime.
None of his offspring will prosper
    by sitting on David’s throne and ruling in Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to the shepherds who destroy and scatter the sheep of my pasture! declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, this is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says about the shepherds who shepherd my people.
You have scattered my flock.
You have driven them away.
You have not taken care of them,
but I will certainly take care of you,
because of the evil things you have done,
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will gather what is left of my flock
    out of all the countries where I have driven them,
and I will bring them back to their pastures.
They will be fruitful and multiply.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will raise up shepherds over them
    who will shepherd them.
They will no longer be afraid or terrified,
nor will any be missing, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen, the days are coming, declares the Lord,
when I will raise up for David a righteous Branch,
who will reign wisely as king
and establish justice and righteousness on earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In his days Judah will be saved
and Israel will dwell securely.
This is his name by which he will be called:
    The Lord Our Righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So, mark my words, the days are coming, declares the Lord, when it will no longer be said, “As surely as the Lord lives who brought the Israelites up out of Egypt,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but, “as surely as the Lord lives who brought up the descendants of the house of Israel and led them out of a land in the north and from all the countries where I had driven them.” Then they will dwell in their own land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Concerning the prophets:
My heart is broken inside me.
All my bones tremble.
I am like a drunken man,
like a man overcome by wine,
because of the Lord,
and because of his holy words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, the land is full of adulterers.
Because of the curse, the land mourns.
The pastures in the wilderness are dried up.
Their way of life is evil,
and their use of power is unjust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Both prophet and priest are godless.
I have found their wickedness even in my House,
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, they will discover that their path
is like slippery places in the darkness.
They will be driven away,
and they will fall there,
because I will bring disaster on them,
the year of their punishment, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Among the prophets of Samaria
I saw something offensive.
They prophesied by Baal
and led my people Israel astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now among the prophets of Jerusalem
I have seen something horrifying.
They commit adultery and walk in lies.
They strengthen the hands of evildoers,
so that no one turns away from his wickedness.
They have all become like Sodom to me.
The people who live there are like Gomorrah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So this is what the Lord of Armies says concerning the prophets.
Watch, I will feed them wormwood
and give them bitter water to drink,
because from the prophets of Jerusalem
ungodliness has gone out into all the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord of Armies says.
Do not listen to the words of the prophets who prophesy to you.
They are giving you false hope.
They proclaim visions that come from their own hearts
and not from the mouth of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They keep saying to those who despise me,
“The Lord has said that you will have peace.”
And to everyone who walks in the stubbornness of his own heart,
they say, “No harm will come to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But have any of them stood in the council of the Lord,
    to see and hear his word?
Who has listened to his word and heard it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, a storm from the Lord!
His wrath has gone out,
like a whirlwind twisting down,
whirling over the heads of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord’s anger will not turn back until he has completely fulfilled the purposes of his heart. In later days you will understand it fully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I did not send these prophets, yet they ran.
I did not speak to them, yet they prophesied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But if they had stood in my council,
they would have made my people hear my words,
and they would have turned them from their evil ways
and from their evil deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Am I a God who is only nearby, declares the Lord,
and not a God far away?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can anyone hide in secret places
so that I cannot see him? declares the Lord.
Do I not fill heaven and earth? declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have heard what the prophets who prophesy lies in my name have said. They say, “I have had a dream! I have had a dream!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How long will this be in the hearts of these lying prophets? These prophets proclaim the fantasies of their own hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They think they can make my people forget my name with the dreams each one tells his neighbor, the way their fathers forgot my name because of Baal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the prophet who has a dream tell his dream. But let the one who has my word speak my word faithfully.
What has chaff to do with grain? declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is not my word like a fire? declares the Lord, and like a hammer that breaks a rock in pieces?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore listen to this, declares the Lord. I am against the prophets who steal my words from each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, I am against the prophets, declares the Lord, who use their own tongues to say, “This is what the Lord declares!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, I am against those who prophesy about lying dreams, declares the Lord. I am against those who tell lying dreams to lead my people astray with their extravagant lies. But I did not send them or command them. They provide no benefit for this people, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When these people or a prophet or a priest asks you, “What is the message from the Lord?” say to them, “What is the message? This is the Lord’s message: I will abandon you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the prophet, the priest, or anyone who says “the message from the Lord,” I will punish that man and his household.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each man will ask his neighbor, “What has the Lord answered?” or “What has the Lord said?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But do not refer to “the message of the Lord” anymore, because each man’s word has become his own message, because you have perverted the words of the Living God, the Lord of Armies, our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You say this to the prophet: “What has the Lord answered you?” or “What has the Lord said?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you say that you have the message of the Lord, this is what the Lord says to you: Since you say “the message of the Lord,” although I have sent a message telling you not to say “the message of the Lord,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: watch out, because I will completely forget you and throw you out of my presence. I will abandon you and this city, which I gave to your fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will bring everlasting scorn and everlasting shame that will not be forgotten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord showed me two baskets of figs sitting in front of the Lord’s temple. This took place after Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon had exiled Jeconiah son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, from Jerusalem, along with the officials of Judah, the craftsmen, and the smiths, and had brought them to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One basket had very good figs, like early figs, but the other basket had very bad figs, so bad they could not be eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord said to me, “What do you see, Jeremiah?”
“Figs,” I said. “The good figs are very good, and the bad ones are very bad, so bad they cannot be eaten.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says. I will treat the exiles from Judah like these good figs, those exiles that I sent out from this place to the land of the Chaldeans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will keep my eye on them for their good, and I will bring them back to this land. I will build them up and not tear them down. I will plant them and not uproot them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give them a heart to know me, that I am the Lord. They will be my people, and I will be their God. They will return to me with their whole heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But like the bad figs, which are so bad they cannot be eaten—this is what the Lord says—this is how I will deal with Zedekiah king of Judah, his officials, and the remnant of Jerusalem who remain in this land, and with those who live in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make them an object of horror and disaster among all the nations of the earth. They will be a disgrace, a proverb, a taunt, and a curse in all the places where I banish them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will send the sword, famine, and plague against them until they have perished from the soil that I have given to them and to their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the people of Judah in the fourth year of Jehoiakim son of Josiah, king of Judah. This was the first year of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeremiah the prophet spoke to all the people of Judah and to everyone who lived in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For twenty-three years, from the thirteenth year of Josiah son of Amon, king of Judah, to this very day, the word of the Lord has come to me, and I have spoken to you again and again. But you have not listened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord sent all his servants the prophets to you again and again, but you have not listened or paid attention.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said: Turn, each of you, from your evil way of life and from the evil things you do. Live on the land the Lord gave to you and to your forefathers long ago to be yours forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not follow after other gods or serve them or worship them, and do not provoke me to anger with the work of your hands. Then I will do you no harm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you would not obey me, declares the Lord. So you kept provoking me to anger with the work of your hands, and you have hurt yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore this is what the Lord of Armies says. Because you have not obeyed my words,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: watch out! I will send for all the clans of the north, declares the Lord, and I will send for Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, my servant, and I will bring them against this land, against its inhabitants, and against all these surrounding nations. I will completely destroy them and make them an object of horror and derision. The land will be ruins forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will take the sound of joy away from them and the sound of gladness. I will take away the voice of the bride and groom, the sound of the millstones, and the light of the lamp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This whole land will become a desolation and a ruin, and these nations will serve the king of Babylon seventy years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the seventy years are completed, I will punish the king of Babylon and that nation, the land of the Chaldeans, for their guilt, declares the Lord. I will make it desolate forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will bring on that land all my words which I have spoken against it, everything that is written in this book, in which Jeremiah has prophesied against all the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For many nations and great kings will make slaves of them, but I will repay them according to their deeds and the work of their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, said to me: “Take from my hand this cup filled with the wine of my wrath, and make all the nations, to whom I send you, drink it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will drink, stagger, and go mad because of the sword that I will send among them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I took the cup from the Lord’s hand and made all the nations to whom he had sent me drink from it—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to destroy them and to make them an object of horror and derision, and to make them a curse, as they are today. They are:
Jerusalem, all the cities of Judah, its kings and officials,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pharaoh king of Egypt, his servants, his officials, and all his people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
also all the various foreigners there,
also all the kings of the land of Uz,
all the kings of the Philistines (Ashkelon, Gaza, Ekron, and
    the remnant of Ashdod),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Edom, Moab, and the Ammonites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
all the kings of Tyre, all the kings of Sidon,
and the kings of the islands across the sea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dedan, Tema, Buz, and all who live on the edge of the desert,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
all the kings of Arabia,
all the kings of the various peoples who live in the wilderness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
all the kings of Zimri,
all the kings of Elam, all the kings of the Medes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
all the kings of the north, far and near, one after another,
and all the kingdoms of the world which are on the face of the earth.
Then after them, the king of Sheshak will drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to tell them that this is what the Lord of Armies, the God of Israel, says: “Drink and get drunk. Vomit! Fall and rise no more, because of the sword I will send among you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they refuse to take the cup from your hand and drink, then tell them, “This is what the Lord of Armies says. You must drink it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, I am beginning to bring disaster to the city called by my name. Will you somehow go unpunished? You will not go unpunished, for I will call for a sword on all who live on the earth, declares the Lord of Armies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Prophesy all these words against them. Say to them:
The Lord will roar from on high,
and he will thunder from his holy dwelling.
He will roar mightily against his flock.
He will shout against all who live on the earth,
like those who tread grapes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The roaring will reach the ends of the earth,
for the Lord will bring charges against the nations.
He will judge all flesh
and put the wicked to the sword, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord of Armies says.
Look! Disaster is moving from nation to nation,
and a great storm is rising from the ends of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On that day those slain by the Lord will lie scattered
    from one end of the earth to the other.
They will not be mourned.
They will not be gathered up.
They will not be buried.
They lie on the ground like manure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wail, you shepherds, and cry.
Roll in the dust, you leaders of the flock,
for the day for you to be slaughtered has come.
You will be shattered,
and you will fall like fine pottery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The shepherds will have nowhere to flee.
The leaders of the flock will have no escape.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear the cry of the shepherds
and the wailing of the leaders of the flock,
for the Lord is destroying their pasture.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The peaceful meadows are silenced,
because of the fierce anger of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has left his lair like a lion,
and their land will become desolate,
because of the fierceness of the oppressor,
and because of his fierce anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim son of Josiah, king of Judah, the following word came from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord says. Stand in the courtyard of the Lord’s house, and speak to people from the cities and towns of Judah who have come to worship at the House of the Lord. Tell them everything I have commanded you to tell them. Do not hold back a single word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Maybe they will listen, and everyone will turn from his evil way. Then I will relent and not bring about the disaster that I was planning because of the evil things they have done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are also to say this to him.
This is what the Lord says. If you will not listen to me and follow my law, which I have set before you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if you do not listen to the words of my servants the prophets, whom I have sent to you again and again (but you have not listened),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will make this house like Shiloh, and I will make the name of this city a curse word for all the nations of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priests, the prophets, and all the people listened as Jeremiah spoke these words at the House of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jeremiah had finished saying everything the Lord had commanded him to say to all the people, then the priests, the prophets, and all the people seized him and said, “You must die!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do you prophesy in the name of the Lord that this house will be like Shiloh and that this city will be desolate with no one living here?” All the people crowded around Jeremiah in the House of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the officials of Judah heard about these things, they came up from the king’s house to the House of the Lord and sat in the entrance of the New Gate of the Lord’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priests and the prophets said to the officials and to all the people, “This man deserves the sentence of death because he has been prophesying against this city, as you heard with your own ears.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah said to all the officials and to all the people, “The Lord sent me to prophesy against this house and against this city all the things that you have heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now reform your ways and your actions, and obey the Lord your God. Then the Lord will relent and not bring about the disaster he has pronounced against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for me, look, I am in your hands. Do with me whatever seems good and right in your eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you can be certain of this. If you put me to death, you will bring innocent blood on yourselves and on this city and on those who live here, for it is true that the Lord has sent me to you to speak all these words in your hearing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the officials and the people said to the priests and to the prophets, “This man does not deserve to die. He has spoken in the name of the Lord our God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the elders of the land got up and spoke to all the assembled people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Micah of Moresheth prophesied in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah. He proclaimed this to all the people of Judah.
This is what the Lord of Armies says.
Zion will be plowed like a field,
Jerusalem will become a ruin,
and the temple mount will be a high place overgrown with trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did Hezekiah king of Judah or anyone at all in Judah put him to death? Didn’t he fear the Lord and seek his favor? And didn’t the Lord relent from the disaster he had pronounced against them? We would be committing a great evil against our own souls that way!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (There had also been another man who prophesied in the name of the Lord, Uriah son of Shemaiah from Kiriath Jearim. He prophesied against this city and against the land the same things that Jeremiah did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When King Jehoiakim, all his strong warriors, and all his officials heard his words, the king wanted to put him to death. But Uriah heard about it and fled in fear to Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then King Jehoiakim sent Elnathan son of Akbor and some other men to Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought Uriah out of Egypt and took him to King Jehoiakim, who had him put to death with a sword and had his body thrown into the grave of the common people.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Ahikam son of Shaphan used his authority to protect Jeremiah, who was not handed over to the people to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Early in the reign of Zedekiah son of Josiah, king of Judah, this message came to Jeremiah from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord said to me.
Make a yoke and straps and put them on your neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then send word to the kings of Edom, Moab, the Ammonites, Tyre, and Sidon, through the messengers who came to Jerusalem to Zedekiah king of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give them a message for their masters. Tell them the Lord of Armies, the God of Israel, says, “Tell your masters:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By my great power I made the earth, the people, and the animals that are on it. I give it to anyone I please.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I will give all these lands to my servant Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon. I will even make the wild animals serve him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the nations will serve him, his son, and his grandson, until the time for his own land comes. Then he will serve many nations and great kings.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord also said:
I will punish any nation or kingdom that will not submit to this Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, that will not put their necks under the yoke of Babylon’s king. I will punish that nation with sword, famine, and plague, until I have consumed them by his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So do not listen to your prophets, to your omen readers, to your dream interpreters, to your mediums, or to those who cast spells for you. Do not listen to those who tell you, “You will not serve the king of Babylon,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because they are prophesying lies to you in order to remove you from your land. I will drive you out, and you will perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if a nation bows its neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon and serves him, I will let that nation remain on its own land. They will plow the soil and live on it, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I also said all these things to Zedekiah king of Judah.
Bow your neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon. Serve him and his people, and you will live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do you and your people want to die by sword, famine, and plague, as the Lord said would come upon any nation that will not serve the king of Babylon?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not listen to the words of the prophets who are telling you not to serve the king of Babylon. They are prophesying a lie to you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I have not sent them, declares the Lord. They are prophesying falsely in my name, so I will drive you out, and you will perish, you and the prophets who are prophesying to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I also spoke to the priests and to all of the people.
The Lord says this. Do not listen to the words of your prophets who are prophesying to you that the vessels of the Lord’s house will soon be brought back again from Babylon, because they are prophesying a lie to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not listen to them. Serve the king of Babylon and live. Why should this city become a ruin?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If they really are prophets, and if the word of the Lord is with them, then let them intercede with the Lord of Armies, so that the vessels which are left in the house of the Lord, in the house of the king of Judah, and in Jerusalem, will not go to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is what the Lord of Armies says about the pillars, the Sea, the carts for water, and the rest of the vessels that are left in the city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon had not taken away when he exiled Jeconiah son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, from Jerusalem to Babylon, along with all the nobles of Judah and Jerusalem—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yes, this is what the Lord of Armies, the God of Israel, says concerning the vessels that are still in the house of the Lord and in the house of the king of Judah in Jerusalem:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will be taken to Babylon, and there they will remain until the day I come for them, declares the Lord. Then I will bring them back and restore them to this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That same year, in the fifth month of the fourth year (early in the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah), the prophet Hananiah son of Azzur, who was from Gibeon, spoke to me in the House of the Lord in the presence of the priests and all the people. He said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord of Armies, the God of Israel, says this. I have broken the yoke of the king of Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When two full years have passed, I will bring back all the vessels of the Lord’s house that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon took away from this place and carried off to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will also bring back Jeconiah son of Jehoiakim king of Judah along with all the exiles of Judah who went to Babylon, declares the Lord, for I will break the yoke of the king of Babylon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the prophet Jeremiah replied to the prophet Hananiah in the presence of the priests and all the people who were standing in the House of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Amen! May the Lord do that! May the Lord fulfill the words you have prophesied and bring back the vessels of the Lord’s house, and may he bring all the exiles back from Babylon to this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, listen now to what I have to say in your hearing and in the hearing of all the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The prophets from ancient times, who came before you and me, prophesied war, famine, and plague against many countries and great kingdoms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the prophet who prophesies peace, only when the word of the prophet actually comes true will that prophet become known as someone whom the Lord has truly sent.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the prophet Hananiah took the yoke off the neck of Jeremiah the prophet and broke it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the presence of all the people, Hananiah said, “This is what the Lord says. This is how I will break the yoke of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon from off the neck of all the nations within two full years.” So the prophet Jeremiah went on his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the prophet Hananiah had broken the yoke off the neck of the prophet Jeremiah, the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go and tell Hananiah that this is what the Lord says. You have broken a wooden yoke, but in its place you will receive an iron yoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord of Armies, the God of Israel, says, I will put an iron yoke on the neck of all these nations so that they will serve Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon. Yes, they will certainly serve him. I have even given him the wild animals.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the prophet Jeremiah said to Hananiah the prophet, “Listen, Hananiah! The Lord has not sent you, yet you are making this people trust in a lie.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore this is what the Lord says. Watch, I will remove you from the face of the earth. This very year you will die, because you have preached rebellion against the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the seventh month of that same year, Hananiah the prophet died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the text of the letter that Jeremiah the prophet sent from Jerusalem to the remnant of the elders in exile, and to the priests, the prophets, and all the people whom Nebuchadnezzar had carried into exile from Jerusalem to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (This was after Jeconiah, the queen mother, the secretaries, the officials of Judah and Jerusalem, the craftsmen, and the metalworkers had gone into exile from Jerusalem.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The letter was delivered by Elasah son of Shaphan and Gemaraiah son of Hilkiah when Zedekiah king of Judah sent them to Babylon, to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon. The letter said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord of Armies, the God of Israel, says this to all the exiles whom I have deported from Jerusalem to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Build houses and settle in them. Plant gardens and eat their fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Get married and have sons and daughters. Find wives for your sons, and give your daughters in marriage so that they too may have sons and daughters. Increase in number there, and do not decrease in number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seek the peace of the city where I have exiled you. Pray to the Lord for that city, because when it has peace and prosperity, you will have peace and prosperity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord of Armies, the God of Israel, says this. Do not let the prophets and fortune tellers who are among you deceive you. Do not listen to the dreams they dream for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they prophesy falsely in my name, but I did not send them, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord says. After seventy years have passed in Babylon, I will come to you and fulfill my gracious word to bring you back to this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I know the plans I have for you, declares the Lord, plans to give you peace, not disaster, plans to give you hope and a future.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will call on me and come to pray to me, and I will listen to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you seek me, you will find me, when you will seek me with all your heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will let you find me, declares the Lord, and I will bring you back from your exile. I will gather you from all the nations and from all the places where I have sent you as exiles, declares the Lord. I will bring you back to the place from which I sent you into exile.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because you say, “The Lord has raised up prophets for us in Babylon,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: this is what the Lord says concerning the king who sits on David’s throne and concerning all the people who remain in this city, your brothers who were not carried away into exile with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, this is what the Lord says. Watch, I am going to send sword, famine, and plague against them, and I will make them like rotten figs that are so bad they cannot be eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will pursue them with sword, famine, and plague, and I will make them a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth, a curse, a terror, a thing to be hissed at, and a disgrace among all the nations where I have driven them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because they have not obeyed my words, declares the Lord, words I sent them again and again through my servants the prophets. And you have not listened, either, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore hear the word of the Lord, all you exiles whom I sent away from Jerusalem to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord of Armies, the God of Israel, says this about Ahab son of Kolaiah and Zedekiah son of Ma’aseiah, who are prophesying a lie in my name: Watch, I will deliver them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and he will put them to death before your eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the exiles from Judah who are in Babylon will use this curse because of them:
May the Lord treat you like Zedekiah and like Ahab,
whom the king of Babylon roasted in the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is because they have done sinful things in Israel. They have committed adultery with their neighbor’s wives, and they have spoken lies in my name, things I did not tell them to do. I am the one who knows. I am the witness, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell Shemaiah the Nehelamite
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that this is what the Lord of Armies, the God of Israel, says.
You have sent letters in your own name to all the people who are in Jerusalem, to Zephaniah son of Ma’aseiah, the priest, and to all the priests, and you told them the following:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord has made you priest instead of Jehoiada the priest, so that there will be officers in the Lord’s house who can deal with every crazy man who calls himself a prophet. You should put him in the stocks and in shackles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So why have you not rebuked Jeremiah from Anathoth, who makes himself out to be a prophet among you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeremiah sent this message to us in Babylon: It will be a long time. Build houses and settle in them. Plant gardens and eat their fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zephaniah the priest read this letter so that Jeremiah the prophet could hear the reading.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Send the following message to all the exiles.
This is what the Lord says about Shemaiah the Nehelamite. Because Shemaiah has prophesied to you, but I did not send him, and he has led you to trust in a lie,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Lord says this. Watch, I will punish Shemaiah the Nehelamite and his descendants. He will have no one left to live among this people. He will never see the good things I will do for my people, declares the Lord, because he has preached rebellion against the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord, the God of Israel, says,
Write all the words that I have spoken to you in a book.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look, the days are coming, declares the Lord, when I will bring my people Israel and Judah back from captivity. I will restore them to the land I gave to their fathers, and they will possess it, says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are words the Lord spoke concerning Israel and Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says.
“We have heard cries of fear,
of terror, and not of peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ask and see.
Can a man give birth to a child?
Why then do I see every strong man
    with his hands on his belly like a woman in labor?
Why has every face turned pale?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That day is so terrible that there is none like it!
It will be a time of trouble for Jacob,
but he will be saved out of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In that day, declares the Lord of Armies,
I will break the yoke off your neck.
I will tear away your bonds.
Strangers will no longer enslave Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but they will serve the Lord their God
and David their king, whom I will raise up for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore do not be afraid, my servant Jacob, declares the Lord.
Do not be terrified, Israel,
because I will certainly save you from a faraway place.
I will save your descendants from the land where they are captive.
Jacob will return.
He will enjoy quiet and be at ease,
and no one will make him afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am with you to save you, declares the Lord.
I will completely destroy all the nations
    among which I have scattered you,
but I will not completely destroy you.
I will discipline you with justice,
yet I will not regard you as entirely innocent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So this is what the Lord says.
Your wound is incurable.
Your injury is severe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is no one to plead your cause,
no one to bind your wounds.
There are no healing medicines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All who loved you have forgotten you.
They do not ask about you.
I have wounded you as an enemy would.
I have punished you as the cruel would,
because your guilt is so great,
because your sins are so many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why are you crying over your injury,
over your incurable wound?
It is because of your great guilt,
because of your many sins,
that I have done these things to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet all who devour you will be devoured.
All your enemies, every one of them, will go into captivity.
Those who plunder you will be plundered.
All who prey on you will become prey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I will restore your health,
and I will heal your wounds, declares the Lord,
because they have called you an outcast,
saying, “It is Zion—for whom no one cares.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says.
Look, I will end the captivity of Jacob’s tents
and have compassion on his dwellings.
The city will be rebuilt on the mound of its ruins,
and the citadel will stand in its rightful place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thanksgiving will come out of them,
    along with the sound of rejoicing.
I will multiply them,
and they will not decrease in number.
I will glorify them,
and they will not be insignificant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their children will be as they were long ago,
and their community will be established in my presence.
I will punish all who oppress them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their strong leader will be one of their own,
and their ruler will arise from among them.
I will summon him to come near,
and he will approach me,
for who would be bold enough to approach me?
says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You shall be my people,
and I will be your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, a storm is coming from the Lord!
His wrath has gone out,
like a whirlwind twisting down,
whirling over the heads of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord’s anger will not turn back
until he has completely fulfilled the purposes of his heart.
In later days you will understand it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At that time, declares the Lord,
I will be the God of all the families of Israel,
and they will be my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says.
The people who survived the sword found grace in the wilderness.
Israel had continual rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord appeared to me from a distance, saying:
I have loved you with an everlasting love.
I have drawn you with mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will build you up again,
and you will be built up, O Virgin Israel.
You will pick up your drums again,
and you will go out to dance with those who are joyful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Again you will plant vineyards on the mountains of Samaria.
The planters will plant and will enjoy its fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For there will be a day
when the watchmen on the hills of Ephraim cry out,
“Come, let us go up to Zion, to the Lord our God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says.
Sing with joy for Jacob,
and shout for the greatest of the nations.
Make your praises heard and say,
“Lord, save your people,
the remnant of Israel!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Watch, I will bring them from a land in the north
and gather them from the ends of the earth.
The blind and the lame will be there,
the pregnant woman together with the woman in labor.
They will return as a huge community.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will come weeping.
They will pray as I bring them back.
I will lead them beside streams of water,
on a level path where they will not stumble.
For I am a father to Israel.
Ephraim is my firstborn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear the word of the Lord, you nations.
Declare it in the distant islands.
Say that he who scattered Israel will gather him
and watch over him like a shepherd watching his flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord will ransom Jacob
and redeem him from the hand of the one who is stronger than him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will come and shout for joy on the heights of Zion,
and they will rejoice in the goodness of the Lord,
for the grain, the new wine, the oil,
and the young of the flocks and herds.
Their lives will thrive like a well-watered garden.
They will not grow weak anymore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the virgin will rejoice and dance.
The young men and the old will be glad together,
for I will turn their mourning into joy.
I will comfort them
and give them joy instead of sorrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will satisfy the priests with abundance,
and my people will be filled with my goodness,
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says.
A voice is heard in Ramah,
weeping and great mourning.
Rachel is weeping for her children.
She refuses to be comforted for her children,
because they are no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says.
Stop your crying.
Do not shed tears,
because your work will be rewarded, declares the Lord.
They will return from the land of the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is hope for your future, declares the Lord.
Your children will return to their own borders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have certainly heard Ephraim grieving:
“You have disciplined me.
I was disciplined like an untrained calf.
Cause me to turn, and I will turn,
because you are the Lord my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
After I turned away, I was sorry.
After I was instructed, I slapped my thigh in grief.
I was ashamed and humiliated,
because I bore the disgrace of my youth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Isn’t Ephraim my dear son?
Isn’t he my darling child?
I often speak against him,
but I still remember him.
My heart longs for him.
I will certainly be compassionate to him, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Set up road signs.
Make guideposts.
Direct your attention toward the highway,
toward the way by which you came.
Turn back, Virgin Israel.
Turn back to your cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will you turn away,
you unfaithful daughter?
The Lord has created a new thing on the earth:
A female will surround a man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord of Armies, the God of Israel, says.
When I bring them back from captivity,
they will once again say in the land of Judah and in its cities:
“The Lord bless you, you righteous dwelling place,
        you holy mountain.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Judah and all its cities will live there together,
the farmers and those who follow their flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will satisfy the thirsty,
and I will give rest to everyone who is weary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Just after this I woke up and looked around.
My sleep had been pleasant for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look, the days are coming, declares the Lord, when I will sow the house of Israel and the house of Judah with the seed of man and with the seed of animal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as I have watched over them to uproot and to tear down, to overthrow, destroy, and afflict, so I will watch over them to build and to plant, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In those days they will no longer say,
“The fathers have eaten sour grapes,
and the children’s teeth are set on edge.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But everyone will die for his own guilt.
Everyone who eats sour grapes—
his own teeth will be set on edge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, the days are coming, declares the Lord,
when I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel
and with the house of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It will not be like the covenant I made with their fathers,
when I took them by the hand
and led them out of the land of Egypt.
They broke that covenant of mine,
although I was a husband to them, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But this is the covenant I will make with the house of Israel
        after those days,
declares the Lord.
I will put my law in their minds,
and I will write it on their hearts.
I will be their God,
and they will be my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says,
the Lord, who gives the sun for light by day,
who regulates the moon and stars for light by night,
who stirs up the sea so that its waves roar,
whose name is the Lord of Armies:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Only if these ordinances could vanish from my sight,
    only then could the seed of Israel cease to be a nation before me,
    declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
    Only if someone could measure what is above the sky,
    only if someone could explore what is below the foundations
            of the earth,
    only then would I reject all the seed of Israel
    for all that they have done, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look, the days are coming, declares the Lord, when the city will be rebuilt for the Lord from the Tower of Hananel to the Corner Gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The measuring line will stretch from there straight out to the Hill of Gareb and turn toward Goah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole valley with the dead bodies and the ashes, and all the fields out to the Kidron Valley, to the corner of the Horse Gate toward the east, will be holy to the Lord. It will not be uprooted or torn down ever again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord in the tenth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, which was the eighteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time the army of the king of Babylon was besieging Jerusalem. Jeremiah the prophet was confined in the courtyard of the guard in the palace of the king of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Zedekiah king of Judah had confined him there.
Zedekiah had said, “Why do you prophesy and say that the Lord says that he will certainly give this city into the hand of the king of Babylon, and that he will capture it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do you say that Zedekiah king of Judah will not escape from the hand of the Chaldeans, but will surely be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon, and that he will speak with him face-to-face and see him eye-to-eye?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do you say that he will bring Zedekiah to Babylon, to remain there until the Lord deals with him? declares the Lord. And that even though I fight with the Chaldeans, I will not succeed?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeremiah said, “The word of the Lord came to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch for this. Hanamel, the son of your uncle Shallum, will come to you and tell you to buy his field in Anathoth, because the right of redemption is yours. So buy it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Hanamel my cousin came to me in the courtyard of the guard, just as the Lord had said, and he told me to buy his field in Anathoth in the land of Benjamin, because the right to redeem it and take possession of it was mine. He told me to buy it for myself.
Then I knew that this was the word of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I purchased the field in Anathoth from my cousin Hanamel. I weighed out for him seventeen shekels of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I signed the deed, sealed it, called witnesses, and weighed out the silver on the scales.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I took the deed of the purchase containing the terms and conditions, both the sealed copy and an unsealed copy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I gave them to Baruch son of Neriah, son of Mahseiah, in the presence of my cousin Hanamel, and in the presence of the witnesses who had signed the deed, and in the presence of all the Jews sitting in the courtyard of the guard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I gave Baruch instructions in their presence. I told him
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that this is what the Lord of Armies, the God of Israel, said: “Take these deeds, the sealed deed of purchase and the unsealed copy, and put them in a clay jar so that they will be preserved for a long time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord of Armies, the God of Israel, says this: Houses and fields and vineyards will again be purchased in this land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After I gave the deed of purchase to Baruch son of Neriah, I prayed to the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ah, Lord God! You are the one who made the heavens and the earth by your great power and by your outstretched arm. There is nothing that is too difficult for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You show mercy to thousands, but you repay the guilt of the fathers into the laps of their children after them. Great and powerful God, the Lord of Armies is your name!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You give sound guidance, and your deeds are mighty. Your eyes are open to all the ways of mankind. You reward everyone according to what he has done, according to what his deeds deserve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Up to this day you have performed signs and wonders—in the land of Egypt, in Israel, and even among all mankind—and you made a name for yourself as it is today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You brought your people Israel out of Egypt with signs and wonders, with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm, and with great terror.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You gave them this land that you swore to give to their fathers, a land flowing with milk and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came in and took possession of it, but they did not obey you or follow your law. They have not done everything that you commanded them to do. Therefore you have brought all this disaster upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You see that the siege ramps have come up to the city to capture it. The city will be handed over to the Chaldeans, who fight against it by means of sword, famine, and plague. What you said has taken place, as you see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lord God, you said to me, “Buy the field with silver and call witnesses,” even though the city was being handed over to the Chaldeans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen to me. I am the Lord, the God who rules over all flesh. Is there anything that is too difficult for me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, this is what the Lord says. Watch, I am going to hand over this city to the Chaldeans and to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and he will capture it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Chaldeans who attack this city will come and set fire to it. They will burn it, along with the houses. People offered incense to Baal on those rooftops, and they poured out drink offerings to other gods there, and they provoked me to anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the people of Israel and the people of Judah have done nothing but evil in my sight ever since their youth. The people of Israel have committed only evil with what their hands have made, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because this city has aroused my anger and wrath from the day it was built until now, I will remove it from my sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of Israel and the people of Judah have provoked me by all the evil they have done—they, their kings, their officials, their priests, their prophets, the men of Judah, and the people of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have turned their backs to me and not their faces. Though I taught them again and again, they did not listen to me or accept correction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set up their disgusting things in the house that bears my name, and they defiled it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They built the high places of Baal in the Valley of Ben Hinnom, to make their sons and daughters pass through the fire to Molek, something I did not command them to do. It did not enter my mind that they would do such a disgusting thing and cause Judah to sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About this city, you have been saying, “It will be handed over to the king of Babylon by sword, famine, and plague.” But now this is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch, I will gather them from all the lands where I have driven them in my furious anger and great wrath. Then I will bring them back again to this place. I will let them live in safety.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they will be my people, and I will be their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give them one heart and direct them in one way, so that they always fear me. This will be for their good and for the good of their children after them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make an everlasting covenant with them that I will never stop doing good for them. I will put this fear in their hearts so that they will not turn away from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will rejoice in doing good for them. I will plant them in this land with all my heart and all my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord says. Just as surely as I brought this great catastrophe on this people, so I will be the one to bring them all the good that I have promised them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once again fields will be purchased in this land, which you say is desolate, without man or animal, and which you say is handed over to the Chaldeans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Men will buy fields for silver, sign the deeds, seal them, and call witnesses in the land of Benjamin and in the places around Jerusalem, in the cities of Judah, in the cities of the hill country, in the cities of the Shephelah, and in the cities of the Negev. I will restore them from their captivity, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
